publicwhip.spmotion: S1M-45 Phil Gallie: Remuneration of Scottish Westminster MPs—That the Parliament considers that the combined activities of the 129 members reduce significantly the workload of Scotland’s Westminster MPs and expresses the view that Scottish Westminster MP levels of remuneration should be reduced to the level prevailing for MSPs. (lodged on 9 June) Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Nick Johnston, Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding

S1M-45 Phil Gallie: That the Parliament considers that the combined activities of the 129 members reduce significantly the workload of Scotland’s Westminster MPs and express as the view that Scottish Westminster MP levels of remuneration should be reduced to the level prevailing for MSPs. (lodged 9 June 1999) Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Nick Johnston

S1M-45 Phil Gallie: That the Parliament considers that the combined activities of the 129 members reduce significantly the workload of Scotland’s Westminster MPs and expresses the view that Scottish Westminster MP levels of remuneration should be reduced to the level prevailing for MSPs. (lodged on 9 June 1999) Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Nick Johnston, Brian Monteith

S1M-45 Phil Gallie: Remuneration of Scottish Westminster MPs—That the Parliament considers that the combined activities of the 129 members reduce significantly the workload of Scotland’s Westminster MPs and expresses the view that Scottish Westminster MP levels of remuneration should be reduced to the level prevailing for MSPs. (lodged on 9 June 1999) Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Nick Johnston, Brian Monteith, Mr Keith Harding

*S1M-45 Phil Gallie: That the Parliament consider that the combined activities of the 129 members reduce significantly the workload of Scotland’s Westminster MPs and express the view that Scottish Westminster MPs’ levels of remuneration should be reduced to the level prevailing for MSPs. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mary Scanlon, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Nick Johnston
